message: Forget about the cheesy title, do you agree that React is better than AngularJS, as a tool ?! I am a HUGE AngularJS fan, and I don't see how on earth React is better than Angular. What to you think ?
story: Ahmed Zain Mohammed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Forget Angular & Ember, React Has Already Won the Client-Side War
caption: sitepoint.com
description: Mark Brown explains why React's unopinionated approach, wafer-thin API and adherence to the Unix philosophy mean that it has left the competition standing.

data.message:
Angular can't win all fights on all battlefields :)
I'm a fan also but I think angular fits best at small to medium apps other wise something else needs to play the role.
React is impressive and still young and full of prospects but its not clear at least for me that it already won!
I don't see such huge differences between JavaScript frameworks except perhaps some cool utility functions here and there and shorter syntax to achieve specific tasks.

Ok, a point I think needs clarification, A Framework has to use inversion of control, it must run first and call your application, like the Spring Framework for example. A Library is something that is called by your application and it does NOT run independently. With well designed frameworks and AOP (Aspect Oriented Programming), you can make your application framework independent. BUT, this requires proper design with accurately documented Pointcuts. A good framework will work with POCO/POJO Objects and the framework does it's magic through xml or runtime configuration or AOP. I would encourage you all to look at Spring as a great example of that, and I believe that Java is more advanced that .NET in this aspect, although it would not be impossible to have a framework in .NET (.NET framework :) ) that can do similar functionality.

Also, Functional programming vs OO. There is a time and a place for both and the best is to usually mix both approaches. It is also my opinion/prediction that in the future, more advanced and cleaner subsets of Javascript will become popular e.g. coffeescript but withh a significant following and possibly a new syntax.
Angular2 Already has React for Rendering :) https://rawgit.com/alincc/angular-test-table/master/angular2/dist/index.html Benchmarkit your self ;)

It's unequal comparison as angularJs mentioned as framework while react mentioned as a render library, any I wish they come together to a better framework http://www.infoq.com/news/2015/04/angular-react-collaborate

I spent some time fiddling with React, I hated it! I know now I am using AngularJS for the right reasons. For me it's more of a lifestyle rather than a framework! Since I knew about it, It changed how I do and build things, I JUST LOVE IT, the way it's. I even afraid I wont like AngularJS 2 with this weird new syntax
